isis.stitle: CAB: 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 AND 8600 MODELS - REMOVE - CAB DOOR ELECTRIC WINDOW AND DOOR LOCK SWITCH

svcproc.title: CAB DOOR ELECTRIC WINDOW AND DOOR LOCK SWITCH

svcsubproc.title: Remove Front Cab Door Electric Window and Door Lock Switch on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 94 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove driver side front cab door electric window and door lock switch (Item 1) by inserting removal tools (Item 2) into the holes at each end of the front cab door electric window and door lock switch. Insert removal tools at a slight angle toward the switch buttons (Item 3) to ensure that the tips of the removal tools are located properly on the spring retaining clips (Item 4), driver side shown.

Once removal tools (Item 2) are inserted properly in the holes at each end of the front cab door electric window and door lock switch (Item 1). Pull removal tools, in direction of arrows, out away from the switch buttons (Item 3), to release the spring retaining clips (Item 4) and lift the front cab door electric window and door lock switch (Item 1) out of the cab door trim panel (Item 5). Remove both removal tools, driver side shown.

Once the front cab door electric window and door lock switch (Item 1) is lifted out of the cab door trim panel (Item 5), disconnect both wiring harness connectors (Item 6) from front cab door electric window and door lock switch, driver side shown. Lay it out of the way and save for installation, unless damaged and being replaced.

figure.caption: Figure 94. Front Cab Door Electric Window and Door Lock Switch

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. FRONT CAB DOOR ELECTRIC WINDOW AND DOOR LOCK SWITCH

step1.para: Repeat procedure to remove passenger side front cab door electric window and door lock switch.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Rear Cab Door Electric Window and Door Lock Switch on Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 95 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove driver side rear cab door electric window and door lock switch (Item 1) by inserting removal tools (Item 2) into the holes at each end of the rear cab door electric window and door lock switch. Insert removal tools at a slight angle toward the switch buttons (Item 3) to ensure that the tips of the removal tools are located properly on the spring retaining clips (Item 4), driver side shown.

Once removal tools (Item 2) are inserted properly in the holes at each end of the rear cab door electric window and door lock switch (Item 1). Pull removal tools, in direction of arrows, out away from the switch buttons (Item 3), to release the spring retaining clips (Item 4) and lift the rear cab door electric window and door lock switch (Item 1) out of the cab door trim panel (Item 5). Remove both removal tools, driver side shown.

Once the rear cab door electric window and door lock switch (Item 1) is lifted out of the cab door trim panel (Item 5), disconnect both wiring harness connectors (Item 6) from rear cab door electric window and door lock switch, driver side shown. Lay it out of the way and save for installation, unless damaged and being replaced.

figure.caption: Figure 95. Rear Cab Door Electric Window and Door Lock Switch

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. REAR CAB DOOR ELECTRIC WINDOW AND DOOR LOCK SWITCH

step1.para: Repeat procedure to remove passenger side rear cab door electric window and door lock switch.
